author: Simon Robb for Metro.co.uk
title: Father caught by vigilantes after ‘driving 150 miles to have sex with underage girl’
text:
A 24-year-old man was arrested by police (Picture: Facebook/H-Division) A ‘paedophile’ dad broke down in tears after he was caught by vigilantes allegedly driving 150 miles to meet a 14-year-old girl for sex. 
The 24-year-old, who is not identified, is accused of driving from Dorset to a McDonald’s in Hereford after arranging to meet the ‘teenager’ on March 11.
Armed police swarm 'hijacked' Thames boat in terrifyingly realistic drill But upon his arrival he was ambushed by four members of ‘H-Division’, a group of vigilantes.
The man was confronted with pictures of naked selfies and explicit messages he allegedly sent to the fake girl.
The vigilantes claimed he asked the girl not to wash because he wanted them to have a bath together.

Vigilantes confront the man at a McDonald’s in Hereford (Picture: Facebook/H-Division) In the footage the group call him a ‘dirty little nonce’ as the suspect denies arranging to meet the girl.
One of the members says: ‘You’ve been talking to me. Everything’s in the chat logs. You being serious? Don’t wind me up, you c**t.’
Students launch plan to abolish the monarchy at NUS conference He breaks down in tears as police arrest him on suspicion of grooming a child for sex.
The sting was organised by dad-of-three David John Poole who vows to ‘hunt predators online’ on the H-Division Facebook page .
A spokesman for West Mercia Police said: ‘A 24-year-old man from Dorset has been arrested on suspicion of attempting to meet a girl under 16 years of age following grooming. He has been released on police bail until April.’
